jobs.title: Research Engineer / Scientist – Modeling
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are

Percepta’s mission is to transform critical institutions with applied AI. We care that industries that power the world (e.g. healthcare, manufacturing, energy) benefit from frontier technology. To make that happen, we embed with industry-leading customers to drive AI transformation. We bring together:

  • Forward-deployed expertise in engineering, product, and research

  • Mosaic, our in-house toolkit for rapidly deploying agentic workflows

  • Strategic partnerships with Anthropic, McKinsey, AWS, companies within the General Catalyst portfolio, and more

Our team is a quickly growing group of Applied AI Engineers, Embedded Product Managers and Researchers motivated by diffusing the promise of AI into improvements we can feel in our day to day lives. Percepta is a direct partnership with General Catalyst, a global transformation and investment company.

About the role

As a Research Engineer/Scientist (LLM Modeling) at Percepta, you will advance the frontier of large-scale language model building and deployment. You will work on pre-training, post-training (e.g., instruction tuning, alignment, distillation), reinforcement learning (RL), and the design of specialized architectures to push the boundaries of reasoning, decision-making, and adaptability in critical industries.

You’ll collaborate closely with our Embedded Product Managers (EPMs) and engineers to ensure our most sophisticated decision systems are both innovative and pragmatically useful in transforming how companies operate.

  • Identify impactful problems and design research strategies across pre-training, post-training, RL, and specialized model development.

  • Prototype and scale training pipelines for large language models, experiment with model architectures, optimization techniques, and post-training strategies.

  • Contribute to infrastructure for high-performance distributed training.

  • Conduct in-the-wild evaluations at scale that drive millions of dollars in value.

  • Partner with our applied AI engineers to transition successful research ideas into robust features of our Mosaic platform.

  • Communicate research outcomes to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, making sure everyone understands the “so what” of research and how to apply it.

You may be a good fit if you

  • Have an MS/PhD in Computer Science, ML, a related field, or equivalent experience.

  • Have depth in LLM and ML fundamentals from optimization to large scale training to Reinforcement Learning

  • Are comfortable implementing and debugging large-scale ML systems.

  • Are motivated by impact in critical industries including healthcare, supply chains, energy, and finance.

  • Have a proven track record of execution.

  • Are an excellent communicator with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Enjoy extreme ownership.

  • Are passionate about AI’s transformative potential.

We're working against an incredibly ambitious mission. It won't be easy but it will likely be the most fulfilling work of your career. If that excites you, let's chat, even if you don't meet all of the qualifications above.

jobs.title: Research Engineer / Scientist – Reinforcement Learning (RL)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are

Percepta’s mission is to transform critical institutions with applied AI. We care that industries that power the world (e.g. healthcare, manufacturing, energy) benefit from frontier technology. To make that happen, we embed with industry-leading customers to drive AI transformation. We bring together:

  • Forward-deployed expertise in engineering, product, and research

  • Mosaic, our in-house toolkit for rapidly deploying agentic workflows

  • Strategic partnerships with Anthropic, McKinsey, AWS, companies within the General Catalyst portfolio, and more

Our team is a quickly growing group of Applied AI Engineers, Embedded Product Managers and Researchers motivated by diffusing the promise of AI into improvements we can feel in our day to day lives. Percepta is a direct partnership with General Catalyst, a global transformation and investment company.

About the role

As a Research Engineer/Scientist (Reinforcement Learning) at Percepta, you will work at the intersection of RL research and real-world deployment. You will advance the frontier of capabilities through research on decision-making for critical industries. You will collaborate closely with our Embedded Product Managers (EPMs) and engineers to ensure that our solutions transform how companies operate.

Role and responsibilities

  • Identifying which real-world challenges are tractable for RL-guided decision making.

  • Develop RL methods to perform complex tasks in domains like planning, decision-making, or optimization.

  • Develop and maintain the experimental infrastructure that powers our research, from simulation environments and data pipelines to training and evaluation frameworks.

  • Conduct in-the-wild evaluations at scale that drive millions of dollars in value.

  • Partner with our applied AI engineers to transition successful research ideas into robust features of our Mosaic platform.

  • Communicate research outcomes to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, making sure everyone understands the “so what” of research and how to apply it.

Indicators of a good fit

  • Have an MS/PhD in Computer Science, ML, or related field, or equivalent experience.

  • Have a track record of effective RL work.

  • Are motivated by impact in critical industries including healthcare, supply chains, energy, and finance.

  • Understand how to perform rigorous RL experimentation.

  • Enjoy extreme ownership.

  • Believe that AI can drive transformative change in critical industries.

The following list can be a sign that you might be a good technical fit:

  • High performance, large scale distributed systems.

  • Large scale LLM training or RL training.

  • Possess strong programming skills, especially in Python.

  • Implementing LLM post-training algorithms.

  • Experience with vLLM/SGLang, Ray, Kubernetes (or AWS EKS).

  • Experience with distributed checkpointing, multi-node, multi-gpu training, custom KV-caching.

  • Experience with asynchronous training and inference, either with VeRL, ROLL, SkyRL, AReal, or with RL libraries like CleanRL.

We're working against an incredibly ambitious mission. It won't be easy but it will likely be the most fulfilling work of your career. If that excites you, let's chat, even if you don't meet all of the qualifications above.

jobs.title: Applied AI Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are

Percepta’s mission is to transform critical institutions with applied AI. We care that industries that power the world (e.g. healthcare, manufacturing, energy) benefit from frontier technology.

To make that happen, we embed with industry-leading customers to drive AI transformation. We bring together:

  • Forward-deployed expertise in engineering, product, and research

  • Mosaic, our in-house toolkit for rapidly deploying agentic workflows

  • Strategic partnerships with Anthropic, McKinsey, AWS, companies within the General Catalyst portfolio, and more

Our team is a quickly growing group of Applied AI Engineers, Embedded Product Managers and Researchers motivated by diffusing the promise of AI into improvements we can feel in our day to day lives.

Percepta is a direct partnership with General Catalyst, a global transformation and investment company.

About the role

We’re hiring Applied AI Engineers who will work directly with customer executives, operators, and technical teams to define and deliver high-impact AI systems. We don't build prototypes or laboratory projects- you’ll design, build, and ship production-grade AI agents and workflows that drive millions in business value for customers.

Our Applied AI Engineers:

  • Shape the AI vision: Collaborate with customer stakeholders to define their long-term AI strategy and transformation roadmap.

  • Identify high-leverage use cases: Work backwards from the long-term vision to surface and prioritize specific AI applications that connect our ambition to measurable business value.

  • Ship real products: Rapidly build and deploy AI solutions that work in the wild, with real users and real data.

  • Advance our core product: Encode the lessons from our customer engagements in our Mosaic product, consistently contributing new features, patterns, and abstractions.

What we’re looking for

  • AI-nativeness: You're excited about the potential for AI to transform businesses and want to play a hands-on role in bringing frontier technology into critical institutions.

  • Being generative and collaborative: You love constantly jamming on new “what if” ideas with teammates and partners.

  • Extreme ownership: You’re willing to jump in and love being the one on the hook. You aren’t going to wait to be pointed at a task—you’re going to identify what you think we should do next, and then do it.

  • Execution excellence and speed: You can build stuff in messy environments and know how to get code written and shipped quickly. You can hold the balance of speed and quality and know when to push the pace vs. when to slow down.

  • Customer-obsession and respect: You’re motivated by understanding customer pain points and iterating directly with end users to deliver wins quickly.

Bonus if you have

  • Hands-on experience with LLM tooling (LangGraph, Mastra, Agents SDK, etc).

  • Built and deployed production LLM-powered systems (tool use, RAG pipelines, multi-step agents, human-in-the-loop, etc).

  • Strong technical foundations in Python/TypeScript, cloud deployment (AWS/GCP/Azure) and DevOps tooling.

  • Prior startup or founding engineer experience, balancing craft, ownership, and speed.

We’re working against an incredibly ambitious mission. It won’t be easy, but it will likely be the most fulfilling work of your career. If this excites you, let's chat, even if you don't meet all of the qualifications above.

jobs.title: Embedded Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are

Percepta’s mission is to transform critical institutions with applied AI. We care that industries that power the world (e.g. healthcare, manufacturing, energy) benefit from frontier technology.

To make that happen, we collaborate with our industry-leading customers to drive AI transformation. We bring together:

  • Forward-deployed expertise in engineering, product and research

  • Mosaic, our in-house toolkit for rapidly deploying agentic workflows

  • Strategic partnerships with companies like Anthropic, McKinsey, AWS and the General Catalyst portfolio

Our team is a quickly growing group of Applied AI Engineers, Embedded Product Managers and Researchers motivated by diffusing the promise of AI into improvements we can feel in our day to day lives.

Percepta is a direct partnership with General Catalyst, a global transformation and investment company.

About the role

As an Embedded Product Manager (EPM) at Percepta, you will collaborate with a team of engineers and researchers to define how a company reinvents themselves with AI.

  • EPMs shape AI transformation strategies that executives can believe in, teams are excited by, and that can create outsized value.

  • We care deeply about delivering real outcomes: ensuring that products are adopted, loved and scaled, without shying away from the complexity of real data and real users.

  • We are creative problem solvers and relentlessly practical: we continuously iterate towards finding the right long-term and short-term tradeoffs, running experiments to validate value and understanding when to leverage our research team for when we need to push the envelope.

  • As an early EPM team member you’ll play a huge part in shaping which customers we target, the product abstractions we invest in and the culture of how we build together.

Responsibilities

This is a lead role with outsized responsibility. The work will range from shaping and executing the AI vision of a F500 company to directing a team of world-class researchers and engineers.

  • Collaborate with customer stakeholders to define their long-term AI strategy and transformation roadmap.

  • Work backwards from the long-term vision to prioritize specific use cases that connect our ambition to immediate business value.

  • Deliver high value workflows by leveraging partners, GC’s startup ecosystem, and building greenfield products.

  • Design high-value workflows with our engineers and researchers.

  • Iterate quickly based on user feedback and partner closely with stakeholders to ensure what we build is loved and trusted.

  • Create systems to quantify the impact of our work and tie to top-level business impact

  • Translate learnings into reusable playbooks that help us drive faster change with future customers.

If you’re excited by the idea of being embedded inside companies at their most pivotal moments, shaping how AI evolves a business, and seeing your work drive tangible transformation in weeks, not years, then let’s chat.

Profiles we’ve seen thrive in this role

  • Former founders who want high ownership and extremely high leverage outcomes.

  • Former engineers who are drawn towards scaling their impact in a more product-forward role (while still being able to build the 0→1 prototype on occasion)

  • Ex-consultants who enjoy strategy but crave less red tape and more rapid and iterative implementation

  • Product managers who want to work on ambitious problems with high-charisma, generative engineers

The list is by no means exhaustive and we intentionally do not want to limit ourselves to the experience above. That said, if any of the above does sound like you then we think you might love it here.

You may be a good fit if you

  • Have a proven track record of executing end-to-end on large and complex products in ambiguous environments

  • Abstract complex systems into the right level of clarity, whether for end-users, engineers, or executives.

  • Are motivated by working on high leverage, impactful problems in industries that matter

  • Exhibit extreme agency and bias towards action. You are fundamentally a “so instead I...” person

  • Are fundamentally excited about the potential for AI to transform businesses and understand the gap between what is needed and existing offerings (pure product or consulting companies)

  • Hands-on experience with LLMs, or the drive to quickly get up to speed

  • Bring subject matter expertise or particular interest in healthcare, supply chain, energy or finance

We're working against an incredibly ambitious mission. It won't be easy but it may be the most fulfilling work of your career. If that excites you, let's chat, even if you don't meet all of the qualifications above.

jobs.title: Strategy & Operations Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are:

Percepta’s mission is to transform critical institutions with applied AI. We care that industries that power the world (e.g. healthcare, manufacturing, energy) benefit from frontier technology.

To make that happen, we embed with industry-leading customers to drive AI transformation. We bring together:

  • Forward-deployed expertise in engineering, product, and research

  • Mosaic, our in-house toolkit for rapidly deploying agentic workflows

  • Strategic partnerships with Anthropic, McKinsey, AWS, companies within the General Catalyst portfolio, and more

Our team is a quickly growing group of Applied AI Engineers, Embedded Product Managers and Researchers motivated by diffusing the promise of AI into improvements we can feel in our day to day lives.

Percepta is a direct partnership with General Catalyst, a global transformation and investment company.

About the role:

We’re hiring a Strategy & Operations Lead to drive operational excellence across a number of strategic priorities at Percepta. You will be our first hire in this role, reporting to our CEO.

As a Strategy & Operations Lead, you will have the opportunity to contribute to all of the following and much more:

  • Enable our GTM motion: Support pipeline tracking across the hundreds of customers & potential customers, developing sales assets and marketing content that tells the right story.

  • Manage our partnerships: Support our partnerships with Anthropic, AWS, McKinsey, Nvidia, and more, and engage with smaller applied AI startups from within the General Catalyst portfolio and beyond.

  • Develop financial & value capture methodology: Embed within our customer-facing teams to support ROI capture, develop and test pricing frameworks, and inform FP&A and strategic finance across the board for Percepta.

  • Translate strategy into action: Partner with our leadership team to ensure company strategy is translated into day-to-day priorities for the team.

  • Help drive our internal core operations: Support our own internal operations, including recruiting, onboarding, legal, budgeting, knowledge capture, people operations, and more.

We recognize the above is more than can reasonably be done by one person. We craft scope for each of our hires thoughtfully based on their interest and expertise.

What we’re looking for:

  • AI-nativeness: You're excited about the potential for AI to transform businesses. You care about supporting a team that is playing a hands-on role in bringing frontier technology into critical institutions.

  • Ambiguity shaping: You thrive when given a nebulous, complex problem. You are always able to take a stab and move things forward.

  • Extreme ownership and accountability: You’re willing to jump in and love being the one on the hook. You aren’t going to wait to be pointed at a task—you’re going to identify what you think we should do next, and then do it. If you say you’re going to do something, you get it done.

  • Generative and collaborative: You love constantly jamming on new “what if” ideas with teammates and partners, and no idea is sacred to you.

  • Outcome over process: You love winning and you hate when anything gets in the way of it. You will invest in process when it’s the right way to scale, but you will never let perfect be the enemy of good.

  • Speed and hustle: You care about getting the job done, and won’t hesitate to cut corners or do the hard thing if it means the job can get done. You’ll never let things get put off for months.

Bonus if you have:

  • 4-8 years of experience working in highly rigorous environments (finance, consulting, engineering, product, GTM) and a track record of demonstrated excellence

  • Extremely strong, professional, and crisp verbal and written communications

  • Strong finance fundamentals (e.g. ability to support FP&A, read a balance sheet, help with due diligence materials, etc.)

  • Hands-on engineering or product experience and an interest in transitioning to a more strategy or operations focused role

  • Experience with standing up and managing operational systems (e.g. ATS, CRM)

  • Prior startup or founder experience, balancing craft, ownership, and speed.

We’re working against an incredibly ambitious mission. It won’t be easy, but it will likely be the most fulfilling work of your career. If this excites you, let's chat, even if you don't meet all of the qualifications above.

 - Ambiguity shaping: You thrive when given a nebulous, complex problem. You are always able to take a stab and move things forward.

 - Extreme ownership and accountability: You’re willing to jump in and love being the one on the hook. You aren’t going to wait to be pointed at a task—you’re going to identify what you think we should do next, and then do it. If you say you’re going to do something, you get it done.

 - Generative and collaborative: You love constantly jamming on new “what if” ideas with teammates and partners, and no idea is sacred to you.

 - Outcome over process: You love winning and you hate when anything gets in the way of it. You will invest in process when it’s the right way to scale, but you will never let perfect be the enemy of good.

 - Speed and hustle: You care about getting the job done, and won’t hesitate to cut corners or do the hard thing if it means the job can get done. You’ll never let things get put off for months.


BONUS IF YOU HAVE:

 - 4-8 years of experience working in highly rigorous environments (finance, consulting, engineering, product, GTM) and a track record of demonstrated excellence

 - Extremely strong, professional, and crisp verbal and written communications

 - Strong finance fundamentals (e.g. ability to support FP&A, read a balance sheet, help with due diligence materials, etc.)

 - Hands-on engineering or product experience and an interest in transitioning to a more strategy or operations focused role

 - Experience with standing up and managing operational systems (e.g. ATS, CRM)

 - Prior startup or founder experience, balancing craft, ownership, and speed.

We’re working against an incredibly ambitious mission. It won’t be easy, but it will likely be the most fulfilling work of your career. If this excites you, let's chat, even if you don't meet all of the qualifications above.

jobs.title: Research Engineer / Scientist – Optimization
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are

Percepta’s mission is to transform critical institutions with applied AI. We care that industries that power the world (e.g. healthcare, manufacturing, energy) benefit from frontier technology. To make that happen, we embed with industry-leading customers to drive AI transformation. We bring together:

  • Forward-deployed expertise in engineering, product, and research

  • Mosaic, our in-house toolkit for rapidly deploying agentic workflows

  • Strategic partnerships with Anthropic, McKinsey, AWS, companies within the General Catalyst portfolio, and more

Our team is a quickly growing group of Applied AI Engineers, Embedded Product Managers and Researchers motivated by diffusing the promise of AI into improvements we can feel in our day to day lives. Percepta is a direct partnership with General Catalyst, a global transformation and investment company.

About the role

As a Research Engineer/Scientist (Optimization) at Percepta, you’ll work at the intersection of AI research and real-world impact. You will advance the frontier of decision-making for critical industries by combining modern machine learning with rigorous optimization research. You’ll collaborate closely with our Embedded Product Managers (EPMs) and engineers to ensure our most sophisticated decision systems are both innovative and pragmatically useful in transforming how companies operate.

Responsibilities

  • Set and drive ambitious research programs that expand what’s achievable in data-driven decision-making.

  • Invent new optimization-and-ML methods for high-impact problems such as planning, scheduling, routing, pricing, and inventory.

  • Build high-fidelity simulators and rigorous benchmarks that mirror real-world constraints, uncertainty, and multi-objective trade-offs.

  • Bridge research into practice by partnering with our engineers to rapidly prototype solutions and implement successful research ideas.

You may be a good fit if you

  • Hold a degree in Computer Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, or Applied Mathematics (MS/PhD preferred) or have equivalent research/ industry experience.

  • Have depth in operations or mathematical optimization (LP/MIP/MINLP, CP, stochastic/robust optimization, causal inference).

  • Have experience in novel machine learning techniques for Operations Research.

  • Are comfortable implementing and debugging large-scale optimization systems.

  • Are motivated by impact in critical industries including healthcare, supply chains, energy, and finance.

  • Have a proven track record of execution.

  • Are an excellent communicator with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Enjoy extreme ownership.

  • Are passionate about AI’s transformative potential.

We're working against an incredibly ambitious mission. It won't be easy but it will likely be the most fulfilling work of your career. If that excites you, let's chat, even if you don't meet all of the qualifications above.

jobs.title: Talent Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are

Percepta’s mission is to transform critical institutions with applied AI. We care that industries that power the world (e.g. healthcare, manufacturing, energy) benefit from frontier technology.

To make that happen, we embed with industry-leading customers to drive AI transformation. We bring together:

  • Forward-deployed expertise in engineering, product, and research

  • Mosaic, our in-house toolkit for rapidly deploying agentic workflows

  • Strategic partnerships with Anthropic, McKinsey, AWS, companies within the General Catalyst portfolio, and more

Our team is a quickly growing group of Applied AI Engineers, Embedded Product Managers and Researchers motivated by diffusing the promise of AI into improvements we can feel in our day to day lives.

Percepta is a direct partnership with General Catalyst, a global transformation and investment company.

About the role

As Talent Lead, you’ll be both the architect and the operator of Percepta’s hiring engine. This is a true player-coach role: you’ll run searches yourself, close high-priority candidates, and also put in place the systems, processes, and bar-raising practices that will scale our team.

You’ll partner directly with the CEO and execs on hiring goals, headcount planning, and compensation strategy, while also rolling up your sleeves to ensure pipelines are full and candidates have an excellent experience. You’ll manage and coach early recruiters, define what “great” looks like in hiring at Percepta, and help embed that bar across the organization.

We take hiring seriously and it’s one of our strongest levers for building a company that changes how critical industries adopt AI. If you thrive in early-stage, fast-moving environments and love both closing the next critical hire and designing the systems that scale the next 50, we’d love to meet you.

What you’ll do

  • Run full-cycle recruiting across engineering, AI/ML, product, operations, and leadership roles.

  • Partner with leadership on hiring priorities, headcount planning, leveling, and compensation.

  • Coach and scale the team and help everyone at Percepta raise their hiring bar.

  • Own recruiting operations: track funnel health, forecast needs, and optimize hiring metrics

  • Evolve candidate experience: design interview processes, reimagine how we assess, and refine our story in the market.

  • Lay foundations for people systems: onboarding, contractor sourcing, and employer brand.

What we’re looking for

  • 5–10 years in recruiting, talent strategy, or operations, ideally at a high-growth startup or top-tier hiring org.

  • Hands-on recruiting strength: ability to source, pitch, and close world-class technical and business talent.

  • Systems thinker who can design and rigorously measure hiring pipelines.

  • Excellent communicator with strong judgment and taste in how we tell our story and present our bar.

  • High ownership, low ego: excited to both lead strategy and personally run critical searches.

  • Bias for action: proven ability to move fast, find creative paths, and deliver results under pressure.

We’re working against an incredibly ambitious mission. It won’t be easy, but it will likely be the most fulfilling work of your career. If this excites you, let's chat, even if you don't meet all of the qualifications above.

jobs.title: Embedded Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are

Percepta’s mission is to transform critical institutions with applied AI. We care that industries that power the world (e.g. healthcare, manufacturing, energy) benefit from frontier technology.

To make that happen, we collaborate with our industry-leading customers to drive AI transformation. We bring together:

  • Forward-deployed expertise in engineering, product and research

  • Mosaic, our in-house toolkit for rapidly deploying agentic workflows

  • Strategic partnerships with companies like Anthropic, McKinsey, AWS and the General Catalyst portfolio

Our team is a quickly growing group of Applied AI Engineers, Embedded Product Managers and Researchers motivated by diffusing the promise of AI into improvements we can feel in our day to day lives.

Percepta is a direct partnership with General Catalyst, a global transformation and investment company.

About the role

As an Embedded Product Manager (EPM) at Percepta, you will collaborate with a team of engineers and researchers to define how a company reinvents themselves with AI.

  • EPMs shape AI transformation strategies that executives can believe in, teams are excited by, and that can create outsized value.

  • We care deeply about delivering real outcomes: ensuring that products are adopted, loved and scaled, without shying away from the complexity of real data and real users.

  • We are creative problem solvers and relentlessly practical: we continuously iterate towards finding the right long-term and short-term tradeoffs, running experiments to validate value and understanding when to leverage our research team for when we need to push the envelope.

  • As an early EPM team member you’ll play a huge part in shaping which customers we target, the product abstractions we invest in and the culture of how we build together.

Responsibilities

This is a lead role with outsized responsibility. The work will range from shaping and executing the AI vision of a F500 company to directing a team of world-class researchers and engineers.

  • Collaborate with customer stakeholders to define their long-term AI strategy and transformation roadmap.

  • Work backwards from the long-term vision to prioritize specific use cases that connect our ambition to immediate business value.

  • Deliver high value workflows by leveraging partners, GC’s startup ecosystem, and building greenfield products.

  • Design high-value workflows with our engineers and researchers.

  • Iterate quickly based on user feedback and partner closely with stakeholders to ensure what we build is loved and trusted.

  • Create systems to quantify the impact of our work and tie to top-level business impact

  • Translate learnings into reusable playbooks that help us drive faster change with future customers.

If you’re excited by the idea of being embedded inside companies at their most pivotal moments, shaping how AI evolves a business, and seeing your work drive tangible transformation in weeks, not years, then let’s chat.

Profiles we’ve seen thrive in this role

  • Former founders who want high ownership and extremely high leverage outcomes.

  • Former engineers who are drawn towards scaling their impact in a more product-forward role (while still being able to build the 0→1 prototype on occasion)

  • Ex-consultants who enjoy strategy but crave less red tape and more rapid and iterative implementation

  • Product managers who want to work on ambitious problems with high-charisma, generative engineers

The list is by no means exhaustive and we intentionally do not want to limit ourselves to the experience above. That said, if any of the above does sound like you then we think you might love it here.

You may be a good fit if you

  • Have a proven track record of executing end-to-end on large and complex products in ambiguous environments

  • Abstract complex systems into the right level of clarity, whether for end-users, engineers, or executives.

  • Are motivated by working on high leverage, impactful problems in industries that matter

  • Exhibit extreme agency and bias towards action. You are fundamentally a “so instead I...” person

  • Are fundamentally excited about the potential for AI to transform businesses and understand the gap between what is needed and existing offerings (pure product or consulting companies)

  • Hands-on experience with LLMs, or the drive to quickly get up to speed

  • Bring subject matter expertise or particular interest in healthcare, supply chain, energy or finance

We're working against an incredibly ambitious mission. It won't be easy but it may be the most fulfilling work of your career. If that excites you, let's chat, even if you don't meet all of the qualifications above.
